descriptions.additionalEducation: Classes are taught by experienced teachers and highly qualified specialists from leading partner companies of ATC. The college cooperates with business structures and government agencies on issues of organizing internships and employment of students. Upon completion of the training, the listener is issued a graduation document, established by the ATC: a training certificate, a certificate of advanced training, a diploma of professional retraining.

titles.seven: LAND RECLAMATION, REHABILITATION, AND SOIL PROTECTION

descriptions.one: Welcome to our university, we have a lot here
descriptions.two: Agronomy is the science of cultivating agricultural crops, improving soil, and increasing yield.
descriptions.three: Veterinary science is the study of diagnosing, treating, and preventing diseases in animals.
descriptions.four: Hydraulic engineering is the science of water resources and their utilization.
descriptions.five: Land management is the science of the rational use of land resources.
descriptions.six: Ichthyology is the science of fish and their behavior.
descriptions.seven: Land reclamation is the science of improving land for agricultural use.
descriptions.eight: Geodesy is the science of measuring and mapping the Earth.
descriptions.nine: Informatics is the science of processing and storing information.
descriptions.ten: Agricultural entrepreneurship is the study of business in agriculture.
descriptions.eleven: Ecology is the science of the interaction between organisms and their environment.

capibilitiesStudentsBlock.title: Opportunities for Students to Study Abroad

texts.textOne: Joint educational programs: double diplomas and joint programs with universities abroad.
texts.textTwo: Exchange programs: studying abroad for one or two semesters as part of exchange programs.

cooperation.maintext:
## Open to the World

The Sultan Ibraimov Agrotechnical College is a leader in vocational education in Kyrgyzstan and is actively integrating into the international educational space. It was one of the first colleges to establish partnerships with foreign organizations, enabling the modernization of the learning environment and the implementation of international educational standards.

## Key Areas of International Cooperation

### Educational Programs and Projects

- **Germany (2006)** – In collaboration with the Weihenstephan University of Applied Sciences, a program in "Entrepreneurship in Agriculture" was developed according to European standards.
- **Finland (since 2014)** – The University of Eastern Finland supports the development of ichthyology and fish farming. The college has established an Aquaculture Center, a water laboratory, and a training fish farm, developed courses, and trained teachers.
- **Japan (since 2018)** – Cooperation with the Agricultural School of Shihoro (JICA). New products based on local resources (e.g., sea buckthorn oatmeal cookies) have been developed, and practical agricultural education programs have been improved. In 2023, a Memorandum was signed with Iwatani School in Japan for student exchange and academic cooperation.
- **Kazakhstan (2023)** – A Memorandum with Ushkonur College on joint training of specialists in dual education.

### Infrastructure Projects

- **USA (2003-2005)** – The American Mercy Corps helped equip the college with furniture and educational equipment.
- **OSCE (2011)** – "Water Quality in Kyrgyzstan" project, under which the college received a mobile chemical laboratory from the Japanese Embassy.
- **Asia (2015-2018)** – The Asian Development Bank’s "Vocational Education" project. The college established modern laboratories for "Hydrotechnical Construction" and "Veterinary" specialties.
- **Saudi Arabia (2023)** – Participation in a project to improve vocational education infrastructure, including major repairs and laboratory equipment.

## The Future of International Cooperation

The college continues to expand international ties, implement innovative educational methodologies, and improve infrastructure, opening new opportunities for students.

✨ The journey of discovery continues…
